item.description:
We will meet from 11 a.m. til 1 p.m.  The discussion topic will be the Secular Coalition of America and the future of the Secular Coalition of Massachusetts..

In May of this year, Edwina Rogers became the new Executive Director of the SCA.  The following is the link to the SCA press release about Rogers: http://secular.org/content/secular-coalition-announces-new-executive-director-edwina-rogers-0

Rogers experience as a lobbyist and years working for high profile politicians is a perfect fit for the SCA - the lobbying organization for many atheist/secular groups (members of the SCA include the AHA, American Atheists, Atheist Alliance of America, and the Council for Secular Humanism)

Rogers is also a long time Republican, which has some people questioning whether or not someone with this pedigree can be an effective representative for our "issues" - abortion, gay marriage, etc. Read or listen to a very interesting interview of Rogers by Greta Chrsitina at http://freethoughtblogs.com/greta/2012/05/13/edwina-rogers/

The cost of the room is $30 for the 2 hours we use it.  We will ask everyone to chip in a few dollars towards this payment.

If anyone has a specific topic that they would really like to discuss in the future, please post a message or send me an email thru Meetup.

--

Robyn
item.name: Sunday Morning Discussion Group at Nu Cafe
